subcategory_list.name: Introduce-Yourself
subcategory_list.description:
New to the community?
Introduce yourself!
subcategory_list.description_text:
New to the community?
Introduce yourself!
subcategory_list.description_excerpt:
New to the community? 
Introduce yourself!
subcategory_list.topic_template:
You're here! 
We're so happy! 

Use this topic post as an opportunity to tell the community about who you are!

This content will be searchable through the site and also added to your profile, so if you want to be discover-able based on your interests, technologies, languages, and graph-y use-cases, be descriptive!

It's also a good idea to have a descriptive title (that also includes your name) to give others a quick summary of what to expect before they open your intro topic. 

Not sure what to say?
You can start by sharing what you do, where you live, how you discovered graphs, and what you’re hoping to get from the community!

categories.name: Neo4j Graph Platform
categories.description: The Neo4j Graph Platform surrounds the core database, making it useful and accessible for a lot of different kinds of users.

categories.topic_template:
Please keep the following things in mind:

1. did you [search](https://neo4j.discoursehosting.net/search?expanded=true) for what you want to ask before posting?
2. please use [tags](https://neo4j.discoursehosting.net/tags) for additional info
3. use a self-descriptive title

Please format code + Cypher statements with the code `</>` icon, it's much easier to read.

Please provide the following information if you ran into a more serious issue:

- neo4j version, desktop version, browser version
- what kind of API / driver do you use
- screenshot of [`PROFILE` or `EXPLAIN`](https://neo4j.discoursehosting.net/t/how-can-i-optimize-my-cypher-queries/114/2?u=michael.hunger) with boxes expanded (lower right corner)
- a sample of the data you want to import
- which plugins / extensions / procedures do you use
- neo4j.log and debug.log

subcategory_list.name: Desktop
subcategory_list.description: Neo4j Desktop is the Electron based UI for Neo4j that allows you to create and manage databases, install plugins like APOC, Graph Algorithms and GraphQL and install and run Graph Apps like Neo4j Bloom, Neo4j-ETLs and others going forward:
subcategory_list.description_text: Neo4j Desktop is the Electron based UI for Neo4j that allows you to create and manage databases, install plugins like APOC, Graph Algorithms and GraphQL and install and run Graph Apps like Neo4j Bloom, Neo4j-ETLs and others going forward:

subcategory_list.name: Aura & Cloud
subcategory_list.description: Neo4j Aura is the simplest way to run Neo4j in the cloud. Completely automated and fully-managed, Neo4j Aura delivers the world’s most flexible, reliable and developer-friendly graph database as a service. With Neo4j Aura, you leave the day-to-day management of your database to the same engineers who built Neo4j, freeing you to focus on building rich graph-powered applications.
subcategory_list.description_text: Neo4j Aura is the simplest way to run Neo4j in the cloud. Completely automated and fully-managed, Neo4j Aura delivers the world’s most flexible, reliable and developer-friendly graph database as a service. With Neo4j Aura, you leave the day-to-day management of your database to the same engineers who built Neo4j, freeing you to focus on building rich graph-powered applications.

subcategory_list.description: Operating Neo4j in production has many aspects, from security, monitoring, optimization. Topics like #neo4j-graph-platform:cluster and #neo4j-graph-platform:installation are covered separately.

subcategory_list.name: Graph Algorithms
subcategory_list.description:
We've built a dedicated graph algorithm library for Neo4j that you can install via Neo4j Desktop for clustering, path-finding and centrality analytics.
It is well documented and there is also a dedicated O'Reilly book.
subcategory_list.description_text:

subcategory_list.name: Installation
subcategory_list.description: Neo4j can be run on any number of platforms (Windows, Linux, OSX), from cloud environments, on-premise servers, laptops, even raspberry-pi. It supports container environments like Docker and orchestration tools like Kubenetes and Mesos.
subcategory_list.description_text: Neo4j can be run on any number of platforms (Windows, Linux, OSX), from cloud environments, on-premise servers, laptops, even raspberry-pi. It supports container environments like Docker and orchestration tools like Kubenetes and Mesos.

subcategory_list.name: Visualization
subcategory_list.description: Graph Models of connected data lend themselves very well to visualization to gain new insights. Using tools like Neo4j Bloom, Neo4j Browser or dedicated libraries (open-source and commercial) you can get a lot of information out of these.
subcategory_list.description_text: Graph Models of connected data lend themselves very well to visualization to gain new insights. Using tools like Neo4j Bloom, Neo4j Browser or dedicated libraries (open-source and commercial) you can get a lot of information out of these.
subcategory_list.description_excerpt: Graph Models of connected data lend themselves very well to visualization to gain new insights. Using tools like Neo4j Bloom, Neo4j Browser or dedicated libraries (open-source and commercial) you can get a lot of information out of these.

subcategory_list.name: Browser
subcategory_list.description: The Neo4j Browser is a developer tool to write and execute Cypher queries. It helps with profiling, testing and visualization. Neo4j Browser is a React application that uses the Neo4j Javascript driver and comes out of the box with every Neo4j installation, e.g. Desktop, Cloud, Sandbox.
subcategory_list.description_text: The Neo4j Browser is a developer tool to write and execute Cypher queries. It helps with profiling, testing and visualization. Neo4j Browser is a React application that uses the Neo4j Javascript driver and comes out of the box with every Neo4j installation, e.g. Desktop, Cloud, Sandbox.
subcategory_list.description_excerpt: The Neo4j Browser is a developer tool to write and execute Cypher queries. It helps with profiling, testing and visualization. Neo4j Browser is a React application that uses the Neo4j Javascript driver and comes out of the box with every Neo4j installation, e.g. Desktop, Cloud, Sandbox.

subcategory_list.name: Cluster
subcategory_list.description: Scalable and highly available Neo4j production installation run in causal clusters. Those guarantee fail-over and load balancing using smart clients. Consistency is guaranteed with the RAFT protocol and by using bookmarks and write quorums.
subcategory_list.description_text: Scalable and highly available Neo4j production installation run in causal clusters. Those guarantee fail-over and load balancing using smart clients. Consistency is guaranteed with the RAFT protocol and by using bookmarks and write quorums.
subcategory_list.description_excerpt: Scalable and highly available Neo4j production installation run in causal clusters. Those guarantee fail-over and load balancing using smart clients. Consistency is guaranteed with the RAFT protocol and by using bookmarks and write quorums.

categories.name: Drivers & Stacks
categories.description: All applications that are built using a database like Neo4j are using database drivers to execute statements to update or query the data.
categories.description_text: All applications that are built using a database like Neo4j are using database drivers to execute statements to update or query the data.
categories.description_excerpt: All applications that are built using a database like Neo4j are using database drivers to execute statements to update or query the data.

subcategory_list.name: GraphQL & GRANDstack
subcategory_list.description: GraphQL is an API query language that allows you to express the data needs of your UI in an expressive way. It is a based on a strict schema which allows a lot of tooling, documentation, middleware to support application development. We provide integration for GraphQL with the GRANDstack (GraphQL, React, Apollo, Neo4j Database) using the neo4j-graphql-js library.
subcategory_list.description_text: GraphQL is an API query language that allows you to express the data needs of your UI in an expressive way. It is a based on a strict schema which allows a lot of tooling, documentation, middleware to support application development. We provide integration for GraphQL with the GRANDstack (GraphQL, React, Apollo, Neo4j Database) using the neo4j-graphql-js library.
subcategory_list.description_excerpt: GraphQL is an API query language that allows you to express the data needs of your UI in an expressive way. It is a based on a strict schema which allows a lot of tooling, documentation, middleware to support application development. We provide integration for GraphQL with the GRANDstack (GraphQL, R…

subcategory_list.name: Python
subcategory_list.description: Python is widely used by Neo4j developers. From building web-applications to writing data science notebooks in Jupyter and running graph algorithms with pyspark. Besides the offical neo4j-driver there is also py2neo which has been around for a long time.
subcategory_list.description_text: Python is widely used by Neo4j developers. From building web-applications to writing data science notebooks in Jupyter and running graph algorithms with pyspark. Besides the offical neo4j-driver there is also py2neo which has been around for a long time.
subcategory_list.description_excerpt: Python is widely used by Neo4j developers. From building web-applications to writing data science notebooks in Jupyter and running graph algorithms with pyspark. Besides the offical neo4j-driver there is also py2neo which has been around for a long time.

subcategory_list.name: Java
subcategory_list.description: Neo4j itself is implemented in Java and Scala. You can use JVM languages to extend Neo4j (e.g. with procedures and functions) but also to build applications. There is also a dedicated #drivers-stacks:spring-data-neo4j-ogm category. Usually people would use the neo4j-java-driver or existing wrappers e.g. for Kotlin or Clojure.
subcategory_list.description_text: Neo4j itself is implemented in Java and Scala. You can use JVM languages to extend Neo4j (e.g. with procedures and functions) but also to build applications. There is also a dedicated #drivers-stacks:spring-data-neo4j-ogm category. Usually people would use the neo4j-java-driver or existing wrappers e.g. for Kotlin or Clojure.

There is also a dedicated #drivers-stacks:spring-data-neo4j-ogm category. Usually people would use the neo4j-java-driver or existing wrappers …

subcategory_list.name: Javascript
subcategory_list.description: Neo4j can be used in JavaScript either for Node backend applications, for web-apps in your browser or even for Electron apps. Neo4j Browser and Neo4j Desktop are examples of the latter, using the official neo4j-javascript driver. A lot of graph visualizations with Javascript are also using that driver.
subcategory_list.description_text: Neo4j can be used in JavaScript either for Node backend applications, for web-apps in your browser or even for Electron apps. Neo4j Browser and Neo4j Desktop are examples of the latter, using the official neo4j-javascript driver. A lot of graph visualizations with Javascript are also using that driver.

Neo4j Browser and Neo4j Desktop are examples of the latter, using the official neo4j-javascript driver. A lot of graph visualizations with Javascript are also using that driv…

subcategory_list.name: Spring Data Neo4j & Neo4j-OGM
subcategory_list.description: Many Java developers prefer to leave the boilerplate CRUD code to an object mapper and focus on the essential business logic and queries. To achieve this we provide Neo4j-OGM a plain Java mapper, that is the foundation of Spring Data Neo4j. It abstracts different ways to access Neo4j (embedded, bolt, http) and uses annotation based mappings.
subcategory_list.description_text: Many Java developers prefer to leave the boilerplate CRUD code to an object mapper and focus on the essential business logic and queries. To achieve this we provide Neo4j-OGM a plain Java mapper, that is the foundation of Spring Data Neo4j. It abstracts different ways to access Neo4j (embedded, bolt, http) and uses annotation based mappings.

subcategory_list.name: .NET
subcategory_list.description:
Neo4j has an official .Net driver but the neo4j-client library offers a lot of nice features on top of that. Folks have also been using Neo4j from F# and Excel.
There are chocolatey packages available for quick installation.
subcategory_list.description_text:
Neo4j has an official .Net driver but the neo4j-client library offers a lot of nice features on top of that. Folks have also been using Neo4j from F# and Excel.
There are chocolatey packages available for quick installation.

There are chocolatey packages available for quick installation.

subcategory_list.name: Go
subcategory_list.description: Go is the latest addition to the official Neo4j Drivers family. Currently in beta, the will be GA in Q4 2018. It is built upon the general C-level driver and connector seabolt.
subcategory_list.description_text: Go is the latest addition to the official Neo4j Drivers family. Currently in beta, the will be GA in Q4 2018. It is built upon the general C-level driver and connector seabolt.

subcategory_list.name: R
subcategory_list.description: Neo4j has been useful for R developers via RNeo4j. A newer driver “neo4r” is more actively developed and maintained. There is additional work for knitr integregration and plans for r-notebooks.
subcategory_list.description_text: Neo4j has been useful for R developers via RNeo4j. A newer driver “neo4r” is more actively developed and maintained. There is additional work for knitr integregration and plans for r-notebooks.
subcategory_list.description_excerpt: Neo4j has been useful for R developers via RNeo4j. A newer driver “neo4r” is more actively developed and maintained. There is additional work for knitr integregration and plans for r-notebooks.

subcategory_list.name: PHP
subcategory_list.description: Our partner GraphAware maintains the PHP driver which also is officially supported by them. It runs on the bolt protocol and also comes with an OGM. There is a separate neo4j-symfony bundle available.
subcategory_list.description_text: Our partner GraphAware maintains the PHP driver which also is officially supported by them. It runs on the bolt protocol and also comes with an OGM. There is a separate neo4j-symfony bundle available.
subcategory_list.description_excerpt: Our partner GraphAware maintains the PHP driver which also is officially supported by them. It runs on the bolt protocol and also comes with an OGM. There is a separate neo4j-symfony bundle available.

subcategory_list.name: Ruby
subcategory_list.description: Ruby drivers have been available for a long time. Since the beginning, neo4jrb provided active-record and rails support and later neo4jrb-core offered a lower level driver. They also support the bolt protocol and also a Cypher DSL.
subcategory_list.description_text: Ruby drivers have been available for a long time. Since the beginning, neo4jrb provided active-record and rails support and later neo4jrb-core offered a lower level driver. They also support the bolt protocol and also a Cypher DSL.
subcategory_list.description_excerpt: Ruby drivers have been available for a long time. Since the beginning, neo4jrb provided active-record and rails support and later neo4jrb-core offered a lower level driver. They also support the bolt protocol and also a Cypher DSL.

subcategory_list.name: Perl
subcategory_list.description:
Perl is still popular in a number of domains, that's why Mark Jensen wrote the REST::Neo4p driver for Perl 5.
You can ask your questions here, @stephen.hall offered to help you out.
subcategory_list.description_text:
Perl is still popular in a number of domains, that's why Mark Jensen wrote the REST::Neo4p driver for Perl 5.
You can ask your questions here, @stephen.hall offered to help you out.
subcategory_list.description_excerpt: Perl is still popular in a number of domains, that's why Mark Jensen wrote the REST::Neo4p driver for Perl 5. You can ask your questions here, @stephen.hall offered to help you out.

categories.name: Integrations
categories.description: There are a lot of systems that Neo4j integrates with, from other databases, data processing solutions like Spark, data visualization tools and libraries and ETL and Reporting tools.
categories.description_text: There are a lot of systems that Neo4j integrates with, from other databases, data processing solutions like Spark, data visualization tools and libraries and ETL and Reporting tools.
categories.description_excerpt: There are a lot of systems that Neo4j integrates with, from other databases, data processing solutions like Spark, data visualization tools and libraries and ETL and Reporting tools.

subcategory_list.name: Other Databases & ETL
subcategory_list.description: Neo4j can integrate with a number of relational and non-relational databases. Either with dedicated integrations and #neo4j-graph-platform:etl tools or via procedure libraries like #neo4j-graph-platform:procedures-apoc
subcategory_list.description_text: Neo4j can integrate with a number of relational and non-relational databases. Either with dedicated integrations and #neo4j-graph-platform:etl tools or via procedure libraries like #neo4j-graph-platform:procedures-apoc
subcategory_list.description_excerpt: Neo4j can integrate with a number of relational and non-relational databases. Either with dedicated integrations and #neo4j-graph-platform:etl tools or via procedure libraries like #neo4j-graph-platform:procedures-apoc

subcategory_list.name: Orchestration
subcategory_list.description: Orchestration frameworks allow you to efficiently allocated and provide resources to applications and services. You can run Neo4j both on Kubernetes environments e.g. via Helm as well as on Mesos via Marathon.
subcategory_list.description_text: Orchestration frameworks allow you to efficiently allocated and provide resources to applications and services. You can run Neo4j both on Kubernetes environments e.g. via Helm as well as on Mesos via Marathon.
subcategory_list.description_excerpt: Orchestration frameworks allow you to efficiently allocated and provide resources to applications and services. You can run Neo4j both on Kubernetes environments e.g. via Helm as well as on Mesos via Marathon.

subcategory_list.name: Stream Processing
subcategory_list.description: Stream processing is used for both service integration and large scale data processing in Apache Kafka, Spark and, Flink. Neo4j integrates with all these libraries.
subcategory_list.description_text: Stream processing is used for both service integration and large scale data processing in Apache Kafka, Spark and, Flink. Neo4j integrates with all these libraries.
subcategory_list.description_excerpt: Stream processing is used for both service integration and large scale data processing in Apache Kafka, Spark and, Flink. Neo4j integrates with all these libraries.

subcategory_list.name: AI, ML, NLP
subcategory_list.description: There are a lot of opportunities of using graph databases with ML workflows. From providing additional features to using graph algorithms for unsupervised learning. Graphs can also represent neural networks, and approaches like graph2vec and deepgl offer interesting insights via embedding extraction and clustering.
subcategory_list.description_text: There are a lot of opportunities of using graph databases with ML workflows. From providing additional features to using graph algorithms for unsupervised learning. Graphs can also represent neural networks, and approaches like graph2vec and deepgl offer interesting insights via embedding extraction and clustering.
subcategory_list.description_excerpt: There are a lot of opportunities of using graph databases with ML workflows. From providing additional features to using graph algorithms for unsupervised learning. Graphs can also represent neural networks, and approaches like graph2vec and deepgl offer interesting insights via embedding extraction…

subcategory_list.name: GeoSpatial
subcategory_list.description: Neo4j 3.0 introduced the spatial point and distance functions in Cypher. Since Neo4j 3.4, spatial points can be stored as properties, indexed in the schema index, and queried at high performance using both range (and bounding box) as well as distance searches directly within Cypher (and we added 3D too!).
subcategory_list.description_text: Neo4j 3.0 introduced the spatial point and distance functions in Cypher. Since Neo4j 3.4, spatial points can be stored as properties, indexed in the schema index, and queried at high performance using both range (and bounding box) as well as distance searches directly within Cypher (and we added 3D too!).
subcategory_list.description_excerpt: Neo4j 3.0 introduced the spatial point and distance functions in Cypher. Since Neo4j 3.4, spatial points can be stored as properties, indexed in the schema index, and queried at high performance using both range (and bounding box) as well as distance searches directly within Cypher (and we added 3D …

subcategory_list.name: BI & Visualization
subcategory_list.description: There is always a strong need to visualize and represent data of any database. That’s not different in a graph database. Luckily there are a lot of options for integrating with existing BI solutions but also dedicated graph visualizations availble.
subcategory_list.description_text: There is always a strong need to visualize and represent data of any database. That’s not different in a graph database. Luckily there are a lot of options for integrating with existing BI solutions but also dedicated graph visualizations availble.
subcategory_list.description_excerpt: There is always a strong need to visualize and represent data of any database. That’s not different in a graph database. Luckily there are a lot of options for integrating with existing BI solutions but also dedicated graph visualizations availble.

subcategory_list.name: Docker
subcategory_list.description: You can easily run any Neo4j version from docker. It allows to set up enterprise clusters and configure the images. The Neo4j sandbox and several of the Neo4j Cloud offerings run on top of the official Docker image.
subcategory_list.description_text: You can easily run any Neo4j version from docker. It allows to set up enterprise clusters and configure the images. The Neo4j sandbox and several of the Neo4j Cloud offerings run on top of the official Docker image.
subcategory_list.description_excerpt: You can easily run any Neo4j version from docker. It allows to set up enterprise clusters and configure the images. The Neo4j sandbox and several of the Neo4j Cloud offerings run on top of the official Docker image.

subcategory_list.name: Linked Data, RDF, Ontology
subcategory_list.description: Welcome RDF / Linked Data / Ontology practitioners (or just curious people). If you're asking yourself how do any of these technologies relate/integrate with Neo4j, you're in the right place :)
subcategory_list.description_text: Welcome RDF / Linked Data / Ontology practitioners (or just curious people). If you're asking yourself how do any of these technologies relate/integrate with Neo4j, you're in the right place :)
subcategory_list.description_excerpt: Welcome RDF / Linked Data / Ontology practitioners (or just curious people). If you're asking yourself how do any of these technologies relate/integrate with Neo4j, you're in the right place :)

categories.name: Projects & Collaboration
categories.description: Post or browse open source projects, side-project collaboration opportunities, or just toss around and discuss ideas you think would be fun!
categories.description_text: Post or browse open source projects, side-project collaboration opportunities, or just toss around and discuss ideas you think would be fun!
categories.description_excerpt: Post or browse open source projects, side-project collaboration opportunities, or just toss around and discuss ideas you think would be fun!
categories.topic_template:
Publish your open-source project to share with the community! 

The more descriptive you are, the higher the chances of your project being discovered through keyword search. 

(you can also tag any additional contributors in your topic!)

categories.name: Community Content & Blogs
categories.description: Share your blog post, presentations, videos, or other content with the Neo4j community or browse through others’ community-created content!
categories.description_text: Share your blog post, presentations, videos, or other content with the Neo4j community or browse through others’ community-created content!
categories.description_excerpt: Share your blog post, presentations, videos, or other content with the Neo4j community or browse through others’ community-created content!
categories.topic_template:
Help others in the community learn by sharing your blog posts and content!

The more descriptive you are in your topic description, the higher the chances of your project being discovered through keyword search. 

If you paste a raw URL link in the description, it will be replaced by a small preview window when you publish.  You can also tag any additional contributors in your topic!

subcategory_list.name: Neo4j Developer Blog Archive
subcategory_list.description: This is an automatic archive of the Neo4j Developer Blog at https://medium.com/neo4j/.
subcategory_list.description_text: This is an automatic archive of the Neo4j Developer Blog at https://medium.com/neo4j/.
subcategory_list.description_excerpt: This is an automatic archive of the Neo4j Developer Blog at https://medium.com/neo4j/.

categories.name: Local Groups
categories.description: Introduce yourself to your local community! Set-up 'tracking' and stay up-to-date on what's happening in your area! Don’t see your city? Request your location / language

subcategory_list.name: Request your Location / Language
subcategory_list.description: In order for us to create a category for a specific city or language, it must have a moderator. If you are interested in being a moderator for your city, let us know!

categories.name: Conferences, Meetups, & Events
categories.description: Browse or share events and conferences looking for Neo4j speakers! Share events that you're organizing or speaking at with the community.
categories.description_text: Browse or share events and conferences looking for Neo4j speakers! Share events that you're organizing or speaking at with the community.
categories.description_excerpt: Browse or share events and conferences looking for Neo4j speakers! Share events that you're organizing or speaking at with the community.
categories.topic_template:
Before you publish your event, consider if you should post it here or in its respective #local-groups (maybe both!). 
If it's a meetup, it's likely best in a local group. If a conference or event where attendees are likely to travel to it, it may be better here! 

In your topic title, please format it like this:
"Event Type: Title - (City, Date)"

*If you include a raw URL in the body of your description, a small preview window of your event will appear when you publish!

subcategory_list.name: Upcoming Events / Event Ideas
subcategory_list.description: Want to share an event you are presenting at or have an event idea? Share it here!

subcategory_list.name: Speaking Opportunities
subcategory_list.description: Browse or post speaking opportunities for conferences and events in this channel.
subcategory_list.description_text: Browse or post speaking opportunities for conferences and events in this channel.
subcategory_list.description_excerpt: Browse or post speaking opportunities for conferences and events in this channel.
subcategory_list.topic_template:
**Please have your topic subject line in this format:** 
Name of Event (Location - Month Year)

Ex.) GraphConnect (New York, NY - September 2018)

**In body of your topic, please include:** (if applicable)

Description 

Link

Contact information

Submission deadline

Also, please add any appropriate tags :)

Please share your comments, experiences and findings but also ideas and suggestions for the new release.

subcategory_list.name: Neo4j Website
subcategory_list.description: Found an issue on the Neo4j website? Have a problem downloading Neo4j? Feel that things could be improved? Please post here.
subcategory_list.description_text: Found an issue on the Neo4j website? Have a problem downloading Neo4j? Feel that things could be improved? Please post here.
subcategory_list.description_excerpt: Found an issue on the Neo4j website? Have a problem downloading Neo4j? Feel that things could be improved? Please post here.

subcategory_list.name: Documentation
subcategory_list.description:
The Neo4j documentation covers the developer and operations experience for the core product. There are also documentation sites for the Neo4j Drivers, Neo4j-OGM and Graph Algorithms.
If you have feedback or questions for our documentation please post them here.

subcategory_list.name: Product
subcategory_list.description: Nothing is perfect, and we're on a constant journey to make Neo4j better and more useful for everyone. If you found a conceptual issue or have suggestions for larger scale improvement, please let us know.
